title: Twin Cities Kids Outdoor Fun
name: Twin Cities Kids Outdoor Fun
description:
A Map by Trekbody

A map of great locations to bring the kids for outdoor fun. Also check out my Twin Cities Kids Indoor Fun (for the colder months) - http://www.platial.com/trekbody/map/6549#Twin_Cities_Kids_Indoor_Fun

properties.name: Aamodts Apple Farm
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody 6428 Manning Ave N, Stillwater, MN, 550826428 Manning Ave N, Stillwater, MN, 55082 Although not as nice as Pinetree Orchards, Aamodts is easy to get to, and makes a great quick outdoor trip.

properties.name: Bellaire Beach
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody   A nice small shady park - not too busy, with some picnic benches, parking, lake views and swings for the kids. Beach is a bit rocky, but useable.

properties.name: Bossard Park
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody   55110Bossard is a lovely little park with a couple baseball and soccer fields as well as a mid-sized children\'s playground and picnic shelters.

properties.name: Bruentrup Farm
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody Site of the Maplewood Historical Society - the farm is located right in the heart of Maplewood.

properties.name: Como Conservatory (Marjorie McNeely Conservatory)
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody  Como ConservatoryGranted, children will more likely be engaged with the animals in the adjoining zoo, but the Conservatory has just been expanded with a rain forest added to it\'s already beautiful displays. There are also outdoor gardens and paths to wander.

properties.name: Como Zoo and Amusement Park
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody  roseville, mnComo zoo is a wonderful compact zoo that is great for bringing the little ones, since they can explore the whole park, get up close with the animals, and not get exhausted. Como has upgraded the small amusement park attached to the zoo, adding some very enjoyable rides for children.

properties.name: Ebba Park
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody   Ebba is a tiny little park with little more than a playset, some benches and a field, but is a nice change from larger parks around town.

properties.name: Fort Snelling State Park
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody  Fort Snelling State ParkLocated in the heart of the Twin Cities, this park offers extensive hiking, bike and ski trails that link to Minnehaha Park and the Minnesota Valley National Wildlife Refuge. Canoe on Gun Club Lake, play golf, swim in Snelling Lake, or hike on Pike Island where the Mississippi and Minnesota rivers converge. Interpretive exhibits and films on display in the Thomas C. Savage Visitor Center give visitors a good background on the history and resources of the park and area. Trails also allow visitors to hike up to the historic Fort Snelling for a view of military life in the 1820s. This is a day-use only park; no camping is available.

properties.name: Jim Lupient Water Park
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody   1520 Johnson St. NE, MinneapolisJim Lupient Water Park The Jim Lupient Water Park is a Municipal park in a rock quarry with three water slides, log water walk, lap pool, and childrens\' interactive play area. Address: 1520 Johnson St NE, Minneapolis Tel: 1 612 370-4937

properties.name: Lake Elmo Park Reserve
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody   lake elmo, mnLake Elmo is a paid entry ( per vehicle), but has a fantastic man-made sandy lake for kids, a large playground, and picnic tables all around with ample parking.

properties.name: Maplewood Heights Park
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody   Maplewood Heights Park has a great playground to bring the kids, as well as a small pond to walk arround. Lovely.

properties.name: Minnehaha Park
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli  See the Minnehaha Falls, and even walk along the creek below and see the geology (count the steps on the way up/down--it\'ll take your mind off how many there are). Read Longfellow\'s "Song of Hiawatha" at the circular monument. Great food at Sea Salt. Fun bluegrass festival Labor Day.

properties.name: Minnesota State Fair
properties.description: Posted by Lenar3 Midway Parkway, St. Paul, MNBeginning at the end of August, this is one of the biggest state fairs in the country. You can go on rides, look at livestock and farm machinery, watch people carve butter sculptures, see a concert and EAT. Eating is the main focus of the fair. The old standards are buttered corn, mini-doughnuts, pronto pups, french fries, cheese curds, Sweet Martha\'s bucket of cookies, pickle-on-a-stick, and cheese-on-a-stick. (Most things come on a stick). Other good stuff: deep fried candy bars (for real), alligator-on-a-stick, popcorn, burritos, pizza-on-a-stick, cream puffs, blooming onions, funnel cake, and salt water taffy.

properties.name: Minnesota Zoo
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody  13000 Zoo Blvd, Apple Valley, MN 5512413000 Zoo Blvd, Apple Valley, MN 55124 Some think the zoo is still a work-in-progress. It is pricey and not well designed, although improvements are happening all the time.

properties.name: Normandy Park Playground
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody   Location: 2484 East County Road F White Bear Lake, MN 55110 A beautiful little park in White Bear Lake designed specifically for kids 1-5 years of age. Affiliated with Normandy Park Education Center so during school hours accessibility is hit or miss, but it is a perfect place for fun on evenings and weekends as well as non-school days. It is fenced in and has a well-padded play surface with lots of climbing equipment. It is located on the corner of Bellaire Avenue and County Rd F on the East side of White Bear Lake. The only negatives here are that the trees are new, and there is very little shade, but that\'s not unusual. There are some picnic tables by the school, so picnics are possible, but they are outside the gated park.

properties.name: Oakhill Park Splash Pad
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody 3400 Rhode Island Avenue, MinneapolisPicnic Facilities Playground Equipment Pavillion / Shelter Softball Diamonds Football Fields General Skating Area Warming House Trail System Sliding Hill Outdoor Hockey Rink Water Playground Rental Room

properties.name: Pine Tree Apple Orchard
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody  Pinetree Apple OrchardsPine tree Apple Orchard White Bear Lake (651) 429-7202 Open June-February, seasonal hours Picturesque orchard setting offering a variety of apples (Aug-Feb), homemade apple bakery/dessert products, caramel apples, fresh cider, apple gifts, gift baskets, jams & jellies. For family outings-wagon ride, PYO pumpkins in Oct, entertainment. Call for schedule. Tours Aug-Oct are educational and fun, reservations needed. PYO & ready picked strawberries in June.

properties.name: Pinehaven Farm
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody  28186 Kettle River Blvd, Wyoming, MN 55092Pinehaven is a fun little farm with a large "Kritter Korral". Kids rides like Pedal Bikes, and fun activities during various holidays.

properties.name: Powderhorn Park
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli    Powderhorn ParkAnother of Minneapolis\' urban parks. Walk around the lake, check out one of the playgrounds. Especially recommended for annual events like the May Day parade (see the wikipedia entry) and Art Fair (usually in August).

properties.name: Snail Lake Park
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody  45.069641,-93.120332This park has fantastic lake views, a large covered picnic area and even a great playground for the kids.

properties.name: Wedgewood Park
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody   Wildwood Road (County Road E) also known as Hwy 244, just east of Century Blvd.
